text:
Park Row, nos. 37-41
New York Times Building, no. 41 Park Row
[1875?]

{printed label}

Cabinet Photographs.
American Scenery
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Church Street

text:
Park Row, Manhattan, is the street vertically bisecting this photograph.
The New York Times building was at nos. 37-44 Park Row, with no. 44 (facing the viewer) as the main entrance.
The Post Office Building (right) fronted on Mail Street, opposite City Hall Park.

This photograph was taken between 1875 (when the newly constructed Post Office was first occupied) and 1888 (when the New York Times building was razed).
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Church Street

text:
(1) City Hall Park: A view of the City Hall in the northward direction from Park Row (foreground). A reception of the members of the Evening Graphic (newspaper, non-existent today, 1937) Modified Marathon from the Bronx to City Hall is in progress. The foundation of this structure is on the old site of the Almshouse; Major E. Livingston laying the first stone on September 20, 1803. It was occupied on August 12, 1811 and completed in 1812.
May 23, 1925

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, exclusive of Civic"Virtue."
October 1925
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3)  A southward view, showing the rear of the City Hall with the Woolworth Building overtowering the same. Centre Street appears in the foreground with the pedestrian over-pass to the Brooklyn Bridge on the left. Partially seen on the right is the City Court Building.
January 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) A more detailed view of the entrance to the City Hall. This view is westward.
October 1926.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
